page.title: 13 RAILWAY OR ROAD ?
page.content: The{Grimsby Louth Railway}ran its last special trains in 1980 and in 1982 the track was taken up.The preservation society will not be able to run their trains right into Grimsby because a new road will carry traffic into Grimsby from the south.This new road scheme is called the{Peaks {Parkway}scheme. This new road scheme is being organised by Humberside County Council.If the new road is not built it is the wish of the preservation society to open the line right into Grimsby. Only time will tell whether the road or the railway will be built but both schemes will be useful to the local area. The new road will divert lots of heavy traffic away from the villages of{New Waltham and Scartho.}The railway will bring back direct travel to the many small local villages.
